title: Summer 2024 MRx Range Testing
comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed Innovasea MRx. The glider was also equipped with an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull and one Innovasea VMT mounted to the ventral spine of the sub assembly. 

The glider will execute range testing for the new Innovasea Mobile RX in the Halifax Approaches.

deployment_details.deployment_personnel: Tyler Byrne, Matt Mar, Nicole Nerioka
deployment_details.recovery_personnel: Tyler Byrne, Matt Mar, Jude VanderMeer

raw_relationship.comment: SBE43F integrated with Glider Payload CTD SN 0069

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

Serviced by Sea-Bird Dec 2019.
Configured to use Sea-Bird equations (2007 and later):

Calibration Coefficients:
Soc = 3.1429e-004
Foffset = -833.7971
A = -3.5379e-003
B = 1.6218e-004
C = -2.7063e-006
D0 = 2.5826e+000
D1 = 1.92634e-004
D2 = -4.64803e-002
E = 3.6000e-002
Tau20 = 1.0400
H1 = -3.3000e-002
H2 = 5.0000e+003
H3 = 1.4500e+003

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment: (Legacy) SBE 05M Submersible Pump

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted underneath float.

Original pump S/N: 05-10022 and DO S/N: 3962

2025 was put with pump 05-10304 and DO 43-3151.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.
model: 43F

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

2021-Dec-21 Calibration:
Coefficients:
Soc = 2.9919e-004
Foffset = -823.64
Tau20 = 2.10
A = -4.5439e-003
B = 1.4178e-004
C = -1.4785e-006
E nominal = 0.036

Nominal Dynamic Coefficients:
D1 = 1.92634e-4
D2 = -4.64803e-2
H1 = -3.300000e-2
H2 = 5.00000e+3
H3 = 1.45000e+3

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted underneath float.

Original pump S/N: 05-10022 and DO S/N: 3962

2025 was put with pump 05-10304 and DO 43-3151.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

sensor.comment: SBE 5M Mini Submersible Pump

data_logger.comment:
vid=531222760, drybox s/n: 009883

Block 2, Regulus 3.3.0

cell modem: MultiTech MultiConnect® Dragonfly™ embedded System-On-Module (PN MTQ-H5-B02), USB 2.0. Robust antenna utilizes Laird™TRA6927M3PBN-001 in robust enclosure, mounted to a 0.5m mast.
SIM: need to check

Sent to LRI Jan 2024 for Block 2 and Regulus upgrades.

raw_relationship.comment: Electromagnetic water speed sensor mounted thru-hull of SV3-1070. Capable of measuring water speed and temperature. Connects to the CCU.

instrument.long_name: Airmar DX900+ MultiLog (electromagnetic)  water speed sensor
instrument.comment: Electromagnetic - MultiLog Sensor - capable of measuring speed and temperature. Mounted at the forward end of the forward payload bay of Wave Glider, thru hull. Provides water speed input to the core vehicle.

3MPU for SV3-1070. Ports for: Debug, GPSWaves, RUDICS, GPCTD+DO, C3 pump, C3 sensor, ADCP, Expansion

SMC port forwarding currently set-up for port 30022

SMC software version 2.7.0 (as of July 2021)

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted underneath float.

Original pump S/N: 05-10022 and DO S/N: 3962

2025 was put with pump 05-10304 and DO 43-3151.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.
model: 43F

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

2021-Dec-21 Calibration:
Coefficients:
Soc = 2.9919e-004
Foffset = -823.64
Tau20 = 2.10
A = -4.5439e-003
B = 1.4178e-004
C = -1.4785e-006
E nominal = 0.036

Nominal Dynamic Coefficients:
D1 = 1.92634e-4
D2 = -4.64803e-2
H1 = -3.300000e-2
H2 = 5.00000e+3
H3 = 1.45000e+3

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted underneath float.

Original pump S/N: 05-10022 and DO S/N: 3962

2025 was put with pump 05-10304 and DO 43-3151.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

sensor.comment: SBE 5M Mini Submersible Pump

instrument.comment:
LRI GPSWaves software receives selected inputs from: the 1Hz GPS included with the Wave Glider system and a LORD Microstrain GPS-Aided Inertial Navigation System (GPS/INS) device.

raw_data.title: Summer 2024 MRx Range Testing
raw_data.comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed Innovasea MRx. The glider was also equipped with an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull and one Innovasea VMT mounted to the ventral spine of the sub assembly. 

The glider will execute range testing for the new Innovasea Mobile RX in the Halifax Approaches.
raw_data.creator_name: Coastal Environmental Observation Technology and Research (CEOTR)
raw_data.publisher_name: Coastal Environmental Observation Technology and Research (CEOTR)
raw_data.deployment_personnel: Tyler Byrne, Matt Mar, Nicole Nerioka
raw_data.recovery_personnel: Tyler Byrne, Matt Mar, Jude VanderMeer

data_logger.name: CCU
data_logger.comment:
vid=531222760, drybox s/n: 009883

Block 2, Regulus 3.3.0

cell modem: MultiTech MultiConnect® Dragonfly™ embedded System-On-Module (PN MTQ-H5-B02), USB 2.0. Robust antenna utilizes Laird™TRA6927M3PBN-001 in robust enclosure, mounted to a 0.5m mast.
SIM: need to check

Sent to LRI Jan 2024 for Block 2 and Regulus upgrades.

raw_relationship.comment: Electromagnetic water speed sensor mounted thru-hull of SV3-1070. Capable of measuring water speed and temperature. Connects to the CCU.

instrument.long_name: Airmar DX900+ MultiLog (electromagnetic)  water speed sensor
instrument.comment: Electromagnetic - MultiLog Sensor - capable of measuring speed and temperature. Mounted at the forward end of the forward payload bay of Wave Glider, thru hull. Provides water speed input to the core vehicle.

raw_relationship.comment: Planned to move away from having vehicle specific data reports as instruments on flight computer. Put all parameters directly onto flight computer.

instrument.comment:
Telemetry reported by wave glider command and control unit (CCU). This is the serial number of SV3-1070 Wave Glider CCU.

I think we plan to set this up differently now. Putting everything listed as sensor below as parameters directly on flight computer.

sensor.comment:
Measured by Airmar DX900+ Multilog Smart Electromagnetic Speed Sensor thru-hull.

Transverse Speed Range: +/- 6 knots
Longitudinal Speed Range: +/- 60 knots

LRI data output in kt/1000, but should be converted to m/s for standard unit.

Telemetry reported by wave glider command and control unit (CCU). This is the serial number of SV3-1070 Wave Glider CCU.

I think we plan to set this up differently now. Putting everything listed as sensor below as parameters directly on flight computer.

sensor.comment: This is the float heading, as measured by the Airmar WX200 weather station.

I think we plan to set this up differently now. Putting everything listed as sensor below as parameters directly on flight computer.

sensor.comment: Estimated speed of the ocean current based on measurements by the Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor and movement of the wave glider (GPS).

instrument.comment:

sensor.comment: Estimated flow direction of the ocean current.

data_logger.name: 3MPU SMC2
data_logger.comment:

raw_relationship.comment: SBE43F integrated with Glider Payload CTD SN 0069

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

Serviced by Sea-Bird Dec 2019.
Configured to use Sea-Bird equations (2007 and later):

Calibration Coefficients:
Soc = 3.1429e-004
Foffset = -833.7971
A = -3.5379e-003
B = 1.6218e-004
C = -2.7063e-006
D0 = 2.5826e+000
D1 = 1.92634e-004
D2 = -4.64803e-002
E = 3.6000e-002
Tau20 = 1.0400
H1 = -3.3000e-002
H2 = 5.0000e+003
H3 = 1.4500e+003

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment: (Legacy) SBE 05M Submersible Pump
